summary.purpose: Provides individual form field container components for ModularForm, including input, textarea, select (dropdown), multi-select, searchable select, date picker, duration picker, checkbox, and form layout components, with consistent label rendering, validation support, and RTL/LTR direction handling.
summary.problem_solved: Encapsulates individual form field types into reusable, styled components that handle label rendering, validation, state management, and layout while supporting features like sorting, searching, async options, direction awareness, and automatic label width equalization for visual consistency across all form fields.

external.name: react
external.why_used: Core hooks (useState, useEffect, useCallback, useMemo, useRef, cloneElement, memo, isValidElement, Children) for component composition and state.

external.name: react-aria-components
external.why_used: Accessible date picker primitives: I18nProvider, Button, DatePicker, Dialog, Group, Label, Popover for DateInputContainer.

external.name: @internationalized/date
external.why_used: Date parsing and manipulation: parseDate, today, getLocalTimeZone for handling date values in DateInputContainer.

external.name: lucide-react
external.why_used: CalendarIcon for the calendar trigger button in DateInputContainer.

internal.why_used: MultipleSelector component for multi-select form field implementation.
SearchSelect component for searchable single-select form field.
Checkbox utility component for checkbox form field.
useDeepCompareEffect hook for deep comparison of dependencies in ElementsContainer.
Utility functions: cn (CSS class merging), durationToSeconds, secondsToDuration, handleChange, propsAreEqual, useValidation for form field behavior.
TypeScript interfaces for all form element props and types (BaseElementProps, InputElement, SelectElement, MultiSelectProps, etc.).
DateInput component from react-aria-components wrapper for accessible date input rendering.
Calendar component for date picker popover in DateInputContainer.
Re-exported component for international phone input form field.

exports.name: TextAreaContainer

exports.name: FormSeparator

exports.description_one_line: Re-export of InternationalPhonePicker component from dedicated file.

symbols.name: useSortValues
symbols.description_one_line: Memoized hook that sorts options array with alphabetic or numeric ordering.

params.name: options
params.description: Array of objects with label property to sort. Filters out falsy values before sorting.

params.name: sortDirection
params.description: Sort direction: 'abc' for ascending (A-Z or 0-9), 'cba' for descending (Z-A or 9-0).

params.name: sortAsNumber
params.description: If true, parses labels as integers for numeric sorting. If false or undefined, uses localeCompare for alphabetic sorting. Defaults to false.

returns.description: Sorted options array with falsy values filtered out.

details.what_it_does: Memoized hook that sorts an options array using useMemo. Filters out any falsy values, then sorts either alphabetically (using localeCompare for locale-aware string comparison) or numerically (using parseInt and subtraction). The sortDirection parameter controls ascending vs descending order. Dependencies tracked for memoization include options array, sortDirection, and sortAsNumber flag.

minimal_correct.title: Sort options alphabetically ascending

extensive_correct.title: Numeric sort with descending direction

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Sorting string numbers without sortAsNumber flag
incorrect.why_incorrect: String numbers sort lexicographically not numerically without the sortAsNumber flag. '10' and '100' come before '2' alphabetically. Always set sortAsNumber=true for numeric string labels.

symbols.name: InputContainer
symbols.description_one_line: Labeled HTML input field with validation, change handling, and configurable input type.

params.name: name
params.description: HTML input name attribute for form submission. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text displayed beside the input. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: inputType
params.description: HTML input type (text, email, password, number, tel, url, etc.). Defaults to 'text'.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: Initial uncontrolled value for the input. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: value
params.description: Controlled value for the input. When set, input becomes controlled component.

params.name: validationName
params.description: Validation type from helpers (textNumbers, email, etc.). Defaults to 'textNumbers'.

params.name: placeholder
params.description: Placeholder text shown in empty input.

params.name: minLength
params.description: Minimum character length for validation. Applied to HTML input.

params.name: validationError
params.description: Custom error message for validation failures.

params.name: required
params.description: If true, shows red asterisk on label and marks input as required. Defaults to false.

params.name: onChange
params.description: Callback fired on input value change, composed with internal handleChange function.

params.name: onKeyDown
params.description: Callback fired on key down events in input.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr'). Passed to FormElementContainer.

params.name: labelWithDots
params.description: If true, shows colon after label text.

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the label element.

params.name: elementsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the input element.

params.name: title
params.description: Tooltip text on hover.

params.name: props
params.description: Additional HTML input attributes.

params.name: containerClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the FormElementContainer wrapper.

params.name: labelClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the label element.

params.name: elementClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the input element.

returns.description: Labeled input form element within FormElementContainer.

details.what_it_does: Renders a labeled HTML input element inside FormElementContainer. Applies useValidation hook to get validation props based on validationName. Composes onChange callback with internal handleChange function. Supports both controlled (via value prop) and uncontrolled (via defaultValue) modes - when value is set, defaultValue is ignored and vice versa. Renders input with default border styling (gray border, hover darkens). Handles all standard input types and validation.
details.rendered_ui_description: Horizontal flex row with label on left side (showing red asterisk if required, with optional colon) and styled input field on right side. Input has gray border (border-gray-300) that darkens to black on hover.

minimal_correct.title: Basic email input field

extensive_correct.title: Controlled password input with validation and callback

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using both value and defaultValue together
incorrect.code:
// Problem: mixing controlled and uncontrolled value
<InputContainer
  name="phone"
  labelContent="Phone Number"
  defaultValue="555-1234"
  value="555-5678"
/>
// Result: value prop takes precedence, defaultValue is ignored. Code is confusing.
incorrect.why_incorrect: Don't use both value and defaultValue simultaneously. Choose either controlled (value + onChange) or uncontrolled (defaultValue) pattern. Using both is confusing and the value prop shadows defaultValue.

symbols.name: DateInputContainer
symbols.description_one_line: Labeled date input with accessible calendar picker popover using react-aria-components.

params.name: name
params.description: HTML input name attribute for form submission. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text displayed beside date input. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: Initial uncontrolled date string value (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to empty string.

params.name: value
params.description: Controlled date string value (YYYY-MM-DD format). When set, input becomes controlled.

params.name: placeholder
params.description: Placeholder date for calendar (YYYY-MM-DD format).

params.name: onChange
params.description: Callback fired when date selection changes. Receives synthetic event with date string in ISO format.

params.name: onKeyDown
params.description: Callback fired on key down events.

params.name: required
params.description: If true, shows red asterisk on label and marks as required. Defaults to false.

params.name: calendarClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the calendar component.

params.name: inputClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the date input field.

params.name: selectedDayClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the selected day in calendar.

params.name: todayDayClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to today's date in calendar.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr'). Affects label alignment.

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the label element.

params.name: elementsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the date input.

returns.description: Labeled date input with calendar popup trigger button.

details.what_it_does: Renders a labeled date input using react-aria-components DatePicker with an accessible calendar popover. Wraps in I18nProvider with en-GB locale for internationalization. The date input field shows a calendar icon button that opens a popover with a calendar widget for date selection. Handles date conversion using parseDate (parse string to date object) and getLocalTimeZone for timezone handling. Supports both controlled (value) and uncontrolled (defaultValue) modes. Synthetic onChange events fire with ISO date strings for form submission compatibility.
details.rendered_ui_description: Horizontal flex row with label on left and date input field on right. Input field has gray border styling with a calendar icon button integrated on the right side. Clicking the icon opens a popover calendar below the input. Calendar shows a full month view with today highlighted and selected date emphasized. Popover auto-positions to stay in viewport.

minimal_correct.title: Basic date input field

extensive_correct.title: Controlled date range with custom styling

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Invalid date format in defaultValue
incorrect.code:
// Problem: invalid date string format
<DateInputContainer
  name="eventDate"
  labelContent="Event Date"
  defaultValue="12/25/2025"  // Wrong format! Should be ISO format
/>
// Result: parseDate will throw, caught and falls back to today's date
incorrect.why_incorrect: DateInputContainer expects YYYY-MM-DD ISO format strings (or valid date strings parseDate understands). Month/day/year format '12/25/2025' will fail to parse. Always use ISO format: '2025-12-25' for December 25, 2025.

symbols.name: SelectContainer
symbols.description_one_line: Labeled dropdown select with sortable options, open/close state, and custom styling.

params.name: name
params.description: HTML input name attribute for the hidden input storing selected value. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text displayed beside the select. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: options
params.description: Array of selectable options. Each option has a value (any type) and label (string). Defaults to empty array.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: Initial selected value. Defaults to first option's value if available.

params.name: onChange
params.description: Callback fired when selected option changes. Receives the selected option's value.

params.name: sortDirection
params.description: Sort direction for options if includeSort is true. 'abc' for ascending, 'cba' for descending. Defaults to 'abc'.

params.name: sortAsNumber
params.description: If true, sorts options numerically instead of alphabetically. Used with useSortValues hook.

params.name: includeSort
params.description: If true, applies sorting via useSortValues. If false, uses options in original order. Defaults to true.

params.name: selectClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the select button/box element.

params.name: optionsContainerClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the dropdown options container.

params.name: optionClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to each individual option element.

params.name: iconClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the chevron icon indicating open/closed state.

params.name: required
params.description: If true, shows red asterisk on label. Defaults to false.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr'). Affects layout and text alignment.

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the label.

returns.description: Labeled dropdown select with styled button and options popup.

details.what_it_does: Renders a custom dropdown select component with internal open/close state managed via useState. Optionally sorts options using useSortValues hook based on sortDirection and sortAsNumber. Displays selected option label in the select button. Clicking the button toggles the dropdown options list. Clicking an option selects it, fires onChange callback, and closes the dropdown. Stores the selected value in a hidden HTML input element for form submission. Supports RTL/LTR text direction for label and button layout.

minimal_correct.title: Basic select dropdown

extensive_correct.title: Select with numeric sorting and custom styling

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Trying to use controlled/uncontrolled mix
incorrect.why_incorrect: SelectContainer manages its own state internally. You can set defaultValue once at mount time, but changing the external state won't update the select. For fully controlled selects, you'd need to rebuild this component with controlled value + onChange pattern.

symbols.name: MultiSelect
symbols.description_one_line: Labeled multi-select field delegating to MultipleSelector with search, grouping, and badge display.

params.name: name
params.description: HTML input name attribute for storing selected values. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text displayed beside the multi-select. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: options
params.description: Array of selectable options with value and label. Required unless using onSearch/onSearchSync for dynamic loading.

params.name: selectedOptions
params.description: Currently selected options array. Use with onChange for controlled component.

params.name: onChange
params.description: Callback fired when selected options change.

params.name: onSearch
params.description: Async search callback for dynamic option loading. Debounced by delay prop.

params.name: onSearchSync
params.description: Synchronous search callback for real-time filtering of static options.

params.name: placeholder
params.description: Placeholder text shown when no items selected.

params.name: groupBy
params.description: Property name on options to group by (e.g., 'department'). If provided, groups options in dropdown.

params.name: sortDirection
params.description: Sort direction if includeSort is true. 'abc' for ascending, 'cba' for descending.

params.name: includeSort
params.description: If true, applies sorting to options. Defaults to false.

params.name: sortAsNumber
params.description: If true, sorts options numerically instead of alphabetically.

params.name: unremovableOptions
params.description: Options that cannot be removed once selected. Shown as locked badges.

params.name: createNewOptionLabel
params.description: If set, enables creating new options from search text. Shows this label as the create option.

params.name: styles
params.description: Object with CSS class customization for various parts: containerClassName, badgeClassName, className, dropdownClassName, etc.

params.name: required
params.description: If true, shows red asterisk on label. Defaults to false.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr'). Affects label alignment.

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the label.

returns.description: Labeled multi-select component with search and badge display.

details.what_it_does: Wraps the MultipleSelector UI component in FormElementContainer with label rendering. Passes through most MultipleSelector props directly including options, async/sync search callbacks, grouping, sorting, unremovable options, and create-new-option functionality. Handles label rendering and container layout. All multi-select functionality comes from the underlying MultipleSelector component which manages dropdown positioning, search debouncing, and badge rendering.

minimal_correct.title: Basic multi-select with static options

extensive_correct.title: Multi-select with async search, grouping, and creation

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using both static options and onSearch without fallback
incorrect.why_incorrect: When onSearch is provided, static options prop is typically ignored (behavior depends on MultipleSelector implementation). Either use static options OR async search, not both, to avoid confusion.

symbols.name: SelectWithSearch
symbols.description_one_line: Labeled searchable single-select dropdown using SearchSelect component.

params.name: name
params.description: HTML input name attribute. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: options
params.description: Array of selectable options with value and label properties.

params.name: value
params.description: Controlled selected value.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: Initial uncontrolled value.

params.name: onChange
params.description: Callback fired when selection changes.

params.name: placeholder
params.description: Placeholder text shown in the select button.

params.name: searchPlaceholder
params.description: Placeholder text in the search input within the dropdown.

params.name: notFoundLabel
params.description: Text displayed when no options match the search query.

params.name: sortDirection
params.description: Sort direction if includeSort is true.

params.name: sortAsNumber
params.description: If true, sorts numerically instead of alphabetically.

params.name: includeSort
params.description: If true, applies sorting to options.

params.name: disabled
params.description: If true, disables the select field.

params.name: createNewOptionLabel
params.description: If set, enables creating new options from search text.

params.name: dropdownClassName
params.description: CSS classes for dropdown container.

params.name: buttonClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the select button.

params.name: buttonFocusClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied when button is focused.

params.name: searchClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the search input field.

params.name: dropdownOptionClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to individual options.

params.name: notFoundLabelClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the not found message.

params.name: dropdownContainerClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the dropdown wrapper container.

params.name: required
params.description: If true, shows red asterisk on label.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr').

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the label.

details.what_it_does: Wraps the SearchSelect UI component in FormElementContainer for label rendering. Delegates all dropdown behavior to SearchSelect including search filtering, option sorting, creation, and extensive className customization. Supports both controlled (value + onChange) and uncontrolled (defaultValue) value modes.

minimal_correct.title: Basic searchable select

extensive_correct.title: Searchable select with sorting and custom styling

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Attempting to use as multi-select
incorrect.why_incorrect: SelectWithSearch is for single selection only. It expects value to be a single value, not an array. For multiple selections, use MultiSelect component instead.

symbols.name: TextAreaContainer
symbols.description_one_line: Labeled textarea with direction support and configurable height constraints.

params.name: name
params.description: HTML textarea name attribute. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: Initial uncontrolled value. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: value
params.description: Controlled value for textarea.

params.name: placeholder
params.description: Placeholder text displayed in empty textarea.

params.name: minLength
params.description: Minimum character length.

params.name: onChange
params.description: Callback fired on text change.

params.name: onKeyDown
params.description: Callback fired on key down events.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr'). Affects text alignment.

params.name: required
params.description: If true, shows red asterisk on label.

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes for label.

params.name: elementsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes for textarea.

params.name: props
params.description: Additional HTML textarea attributes.

details.what_it_does: Renders a labeled textarea inside FormElementContainer. Applies default min-height (min-h-16) and max-height (max-h-52) with overflow-auto for scrolling. Supports both controlled (value + onChange) and uncontrolled (defaultValue) modes. Applies direction-aware text alignment (rtl justifies right, ltr justifies left). Has gray border styling matching other form elements.

minimal_correct.title: Basic textarea field

extensive_correct.title: Controlled textarea with validation

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Setting extremely large min/max heights inline
incorrect.code:
// Problem: overriding component's reasonable defaults
<TextAreaContainer
  name="notes"
  labelContent="Notes"
  elementsCommonClassName="min-h-96 max-h-96 overflow-hidden"  // Too tall, breaks layout
/>
// Result: Form field becomes unwieldy, doesn't fit in normal layouts
incorrect.why_incorrect: The component already provides sensible defaults (min-h-16 max-h-52). Overriding with extremely large values breaks form layout and usability. Use the default constraints unless you have a specific need for different heights.

symbols.name: FormSeparator
symbols.description_one_line: Horizontal divider line for visually separating form sections.

params.name: props
params.description: Standard HTML div attributes passed to the separator element.

params.name: children
params.description: Optional content rendered within or around the separator line.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr'). May affect layout of children.

details.what_it_does: Renders a simple horizontal divider (1px gray bottom border) spanning full width to visually separate sections of a form. Can render optional children content alongside or within the separator. Respects direction prop for RTL/LTR layouts.

minimal_correct.title: Basic form separator

extensive_correct.title: Separator with section heading

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using as replacement for proper section grouping
incorrect.why_incorrect: FormSeparator is purely visual. Use proper heading elements (h2, h3, etc.) or section grouping for semantic structure and accessibility. Separators should be used in addition to, not instead of, proper HTML structure.

symbols.name: CheckboxContainer
symbols.description_one_line: Labeled checkbox toggle with custom styling options.

params.name: name
params.description: HTML input name attribute. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr').

params.name: checked
params.description: Controlled checked state.

params.name: setChecked
params.description: Callback to update checked state.

params.name: disabled
params.description: If true, disables the checkbox.

params.name: title
params.description: Tooltip text on hover.

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes for label.

params.name: rotation
params.description: Rotation angle for checkbox styling.

params.name: circleClassName
params.description: CSS classes for checkbox circle.

details.what_it_does: Renders a labeled checkbox by wrapping the shared Checkbox utility component inside FormElementContainer. Delegates checkbox rendering and behavior to the Checkbox component from utils, passing through props for styling, disabled state, and rotation.

minimal_correct.title: Basic checkbox

extensive_correct.title: Multiple checkboxes with validation

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using without state management
incorrect.why_incorrect: CheckboxContainer requires managed state via checked and setChecked props. Always provide these props or it won't respond to user interactions.

symbols.name: DurationPicker
symbols.description_one_line: Labeled duration input with separate fields for days, hours, minutes, seconds.

params.name: name
params.description: HTML input name attribute for storing total seconds. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text. Defaults to empty string.

params.name: value
params.description: Controlled value in seconds. When set, component becomes controlled.

params.name: onChange
params.description: Callback fired when duration changes, receiving total seconds.

params.name: options
params.description: Array of time units to display: 'days' | 'hours' | 'minutes' | 'seconds'. Controls which input fields are shown.

params.name: hideLabels
params.description: If true, hides the D/H/M/S unit labels above each input field.

params.name: required
params.description: If true, shows red asterisk on main label.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr').

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: CSS classes for main label.

returns.description: Labeled duration input with multiple time unit fields.

details.what_it_does: Renders a set of numeric input fields (one per time unit selected via options prop) inside FormElementContainer. Each field is clamped to reasonable maximums (e.g., hours 0-23, minutes 0-59). Converts between seconds (stored in hidden input for form submission) and individual time units using secondsToDuration and durationToSeconds helpers. Always renders left-to-right regardless of form direction property. Optional unit labels (D/H/M/S) above each field.

minimal_correct.title: Basic duration picker with all time units

extensive_correct.title: Duration picker with limited options and label hiding

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Trying to set value without proper conversion
incorrect.why_incorrect: DurationPicker always stores value as total seconds. Always calculate and pass seconds. If you have minutes, convert first: minutes * 60 = seconds.

symbols.name: FormElementContainer
symbols.description_one_line: Shared layout container for form elements with optional label rendering.

params.name: children
params.description: Form element content (input, select, etc.) to render alongside label.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text or element. If provided, ElementLabel is rendered.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr'). Affects flex direction and label placement.

params.name: containerClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the container. Merged with default flex classes.

params.name: labelClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the label element.

params.name: defaultContainerClassName
params.description: If true, applies default container classes. Defaults to true.

returns.description: Flex container with optional label and children.

details.what_it_does: Base layout component used by all form element components. Renders a flex row container with optional ElementLabel on the start side (left in LTR, right in RTL) and children on the flex-1 (expanding) end side. Applies default classes (flex justify-start items-center gap-3 w-full) unless defaultContainerClassName is false.

minimal_correct.title: Using FormElementContainer with custom input

extensive_correct.title: Multiple elements in one container

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Not using default container classes
incorrect.why_incorrect: Default container classes provide essential flex layout for proper alignment. Unless you have a specific reason, keep defaultContainerClassName=true.

symbols.name: ElementLabel
symbols.description_one_line: Styled form label with required asterisk and optional colon indicator.

params.name: labelContent
params.description: Label text or element content.

params.name: required
params.description: If true, displays red asterisk before label text.

params.name: labelWithDots
params.description: If true, displays colon after label text.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction ('rtl' or 'ltr'). Affects text alignment.

params.name: labelClassName
params.description: CSS classes applied to the label. Merged with default classes.

params.name: labelsCommonClassName
params.description: Additional CSS classes from parent context.

returns.description: Styled label with optional required marker and colon.

details.what_it_does: Renders a form label with CSS class 'form-label' for use with ModularForm's automatic label width equalization. Optionally displays a red asterisk (*) before the label if required=true, and optionally appends a colon (:) if labelWithDots=true. Applies direction-aware text alignment (rtl for right-to-left, ltr for left-to-right).

minimal_correct.title: Basic label

extensive_correct.title: Label with required marker and colon

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using without form-label class
incorrect.why_incorrect: ElementLabel adds the 'form-label' class automatically for ModularForm's label width equalization to work. Don't create custom label divs.

symbols.name: ElementsContainer
symbols.description_one_line: Container for multiple form elements with automatic label width equalization.

params.name: children
params.description: Form element components to group and render.

params.name: headline
params.description: Optional section heading displayed above elements.

params.name: autoFixLabelsWidth
params.description: If true, automatically equalizes all label widths. Defaults to true.

params.name: autoFixLabelsWidthDeps
params.description: Dependency array for label width recalculation. Defaults to empty array.

params.name: elementClassName
params.description: CSS classes injected into all child form elements.

params.name: labelClassName
params.description: CSS classes injected into all child labels.

params.name: containerClassName
params.description: CSS classes injected into all child element containers.

params.name: childrenContainerClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the wrapper div around all children.

params.name: className
params.description: CSS classes for the outer ElementsContainer wrapper.

params.name: headlineClassName
params.description: CSS classes for the headline element.

returns.description: Container with grouped form elements and optional headline.

details.what_it_does: Memoized container (via React.memo with propsAreEqual) that wraps multiple form element children. Automatically measures and equalizes label widths across all children using useDeepCompareEffect. Injects shared CSS classes (elementClassName, labelClassName, containerClassName) into all children via cloneElement. Renders optional headline with styled border. Particularly useful for grouping related form fields that should have aligned labels for visual consistency.

minimal_correct.title: Group related form fields with auto label alignment

extensive_correct.title: ElementsContainer with custom styling injected to children

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using non-form children
incorrect.code:
// Problem: cloneElement only works with valid React elements "Just some text" // Not a valid element!
Some other div
// Won't have form classes injected // Result: Text ignored, div won't get cloneElement props injected
incorrect.why_incorrect: ElementsContainer uses cloneElement to inject props into children. This only works with React elements. Plain text won't work, and non-form elements won't get the injected props. Use it specifically for grouping form field components.

symbols.name: ElementsContainerProps
symbols.description_one_line: Props interface for ElementsContainer with headline, layout, and label width options.

details.what_it_does: Interface defining all available props for ElementsContainer component, extending BaseElementProps with additional properties for children grouping, headline, label width auto-fix configuration, and extensive className customization options.

minimal_correct.title: Basic interface usage in component

extensive_correct.title: Using interface for type-safe prop handling

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Not using the interface
incorrect.why_incorrect: Always use proper TypeScript interfaces for props to catch errors at compile time. Using 'any' defeats the purpose of TypeScript.

symbols.name: defaultFormElementContainerClassName
symbols.description_one_line: Default Tailwind CSS classes for form element containers: flex layout with gap.

details.what_it_does: Exported string constant containing the default Tailwind classes used for all form element containers throughout the module. Value is 'flex justify-start items-center gap-3 w-full', providing a flex row layout with start alignment, centered items vertically, 12px gaps, and full width.
details.type_definition: const defaultFormElementContainerClassName = 'flex justify-start items-center gap-3 w-full';

minimal_correct.title: Using default container classes in custom component

extensive_correct.title: Combining default classes with custom overrides

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Hardcoding class string instead of using constant
incorrect.why_incorrect: Always use the exported constant instead of hardcoding the string. If the default styling ever changes, you only update one place instead of every component that uses it.

symbols.name: defaultFormElementBorderClassName
symbols.description_one_line: Default Tailwind CSS classes for form element borders: gray border with hover effect.

details.what_it_does: Exported string constant containing the default Tailwind classes used for borders on form input elements throughout the module. Value is 'border-[1px] border-gray-300 hover:border-black rounded-sm', providing a 1px border in light gray that darkens to black on hover with slight rounding.

minimal_correct.title: Using default border classes on custom input

extensive_correct.title: Overriding border styling conditionally

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Creating custom border string instead of using constant
incorrect.why_incorrect: Always use the exported constant for consistency with the rest of the form system. Custom border styling breaks visual coherence across the form.

symbols.name: InternationalPhonePicker
symbols.description_one_line: Re-export of InternationalPhonePicker component from dedicated file.

details.what_it_does: Re-exported value from the InternationalPhonePicker.tsx file for convenience. Provides access to the international phone input component through this module's exports.

minimal_correct.title: Importing re-exported InternationalPhonePicker

extensive_correct.title: Using InternationalPhonePicker in form context

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Importing from wrong location
incorrect.why_incorrect: The component is re-exported from formElements for consistency and easier discovery. Import from formElements instead of the dedicated file to maintain consistent import patterns throughout the app.
